abstract.p: Dr Thomas Q Morris letter on Aug 22 article recalls Columbia University introduced rite in which incoming medical students are cloaked in white laboratory coats and recite Hippocratic Oath

block.p: The article ''Medical Schools Discover Value in Dispensing Compassion'' missed a vital component of this humanism in medicine story. The very first White Coat Ceremony, where incoming medical students are cloaked in their first white laboratory coats and recite the Hippocratic Oath prior to beginning their medical education was held at Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons in 1993.

The article ''Medical Schools Discover Value in Dispensing Compassion'' missed a vital component of this humanism in medicine story. The very first White Coat Ceremony, where incoming medical students are cloaked in their first white laboratory coats and recite the Hippocratic Oath prior to beginning their medical education was held at Columbia University College of Physicians and Surgeons in 1993.
Today, the ritual is an institution at 126 schools nationwide and, as of this fall, at the University of Beijing.
DR. THOMAS Q. MORRIS New York
The writer is the college's interim dean for clinical and educational affairs.
